intro: Strigosella grandiflora var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf strigosella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in desert scrub habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
